Detailed Description

A pattern recognition system typically involves four stages: preprocessing, feature extraction, classification and postprocessing. This class allows to manage the execution and outcomes of every stage, or apply a global character recognition over an input press clip. The execution of any stage produces some statistical data that might be of interest.

As the first important step, image and data preprocessing serves the purpose of extracting regions of interest, enhancing and cleaning up the images, so that they can be directly and efficiently processed by the feature extraction stage.

The purpose of feature extraction is the measurement of those attributes of patterns that are most pertinent to a given classification task, producing a feature vector for each pattern extracted in the preprocessing stage.

The classification stage processes the feature vectors to identify the characters. The feature vectors of input patterns are mapped onto points in a feature space. Depending on the location of these points the patterns are classified as one character or another.

In the end, postprocessing builds a meaningful text by inserting blank spaces between characters to separate the words.

See also:
Dataset, Text, Statistics, Clip, ClassificationParadigm, Pattern, Region, FeatureVector

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Recognizer::Recognizer ( std::auto_ptr< Dataset > &  dataset  )  [explicit]

dataset is not copied by allocating new memory, but owned internally. Thus, it's released and set to null.

Parameters:
dataset The dataset to be used in classification and training.
Precondition:
dataset must not be a null pointer.
Exceptions:
NessieException 

Recognizer::Recognizer ( Dataset *const   dataset  )  [explicit]

Parameters:
dataset The dataset to be used in classification and training.
Precondition:
dataset must not be a null pointer.
Warning:
dataset is not copied by allocating new memory, but owned internally. Thus, be careful with deallocating the memory using external pointer. However, also notice that when a Recognizer object is destroyed, the internal dataset is also destroyed and its memory deallocated.
Exceptions:
NessieException

void Recognizer::doClassification ( const std::vector< FeatureVector > &  featureVectors,
const ClassificationParadigm &  paradigm 
)

The feature vectors of input patterns are mapped onto points in a feature space and assigned to a class of characters.

Parameters:
featureVectors An array of feature vectors that identifies characters to be classified.
paradigm Paradigm that must be used to classify the patterns found in the press clip.
Postcondition:
An array of characters becomes available through the Recognizer::characters() method.

void Recognizer::doClassification ( const ClassificationParadigm &  paradigm  ) 

The feature vectors of input patterns are mapped onto points in a feature space and assigned to a class of characters.

Parameters:
paradigm Paradigm that must be used to classify the patterns.
Precondition:
The Recognizer::doFeatureExtraction() method must have been previously executed.
Postcondition:
An array of characters becomes available through the Recognizer::characters() method.

void Recognizer::doFeatureExtraction ( const std::list< Region > &  regions  ) 

The feature extraction measures the attributes of patterns that are most pertinent to a given classification task.

Parameters:
regions A list of regions from which extract the patterns and its feature vectors.
Postcondition:
An array of FeatureVector objects becomes available through the Recognizer::featureVectors() method.

void Recognizer::doFeatureExtraction (  ) 

The feature extraction measures the attributes of patterns that are most pertinent to a given classification task.

Precondition:
The Recognizer::doPreprocessing() method must have been previously executed.
Postcondition:
An array of FeatureVector objects becomes available through the Recognizer::featureVectors() method.

void Recognizer::doPostprocessing ( const std::vector< std::string > &  characters,
const std::vector< unsigned int > &  spaceLocations 
)

Characters postprocessing builds a meaningful text by inserting blank spaces between characters to separate the words.

Parameters:
characters An array of characters to be postprocessed to build the final text.
spaceLocations Positions in the text where blanks spaces should be inserted.
Postcondition:
A Text object with the result becomes available through the Recognizer::text() method.

void Recognizer::doPostprocessing (  ) 

Characters postprocessing builds a meaningful text by inserting blank spaces between characters to separate the words.

Precondition:
The Recognizer::doClassification() method must have been previously executed.
Postcondition:
A Text object with the result becomes available through the Recognizer::text() method.

void Recognizer::doPreprocessing ( const Clip &  pressClip  ) 

Image and data preprocessing enhances and cleans the press clip up, and extracts the regions of interest.

Parameters:
pressClip Press clip to be processed.
Postcondition:
A list of regions becomes available through the Recognizer::regions() method.

The position of blank spaces becomes available through the Recognizer::spaceLocations() method.

void Recognizer::extractText ( const Clip &  pressClip,
const ClassificationParadigm &  paradigm 
)

This method executes sequentially all the recognition stages: preprocessing, feature extraction, classification and postprocessing.

Parameters:
pressClip Press clip to be processed.
paradigm Paradigm that must be used to classify the patterns found in the press clip.
Postcondition:
A Text object with the result becomes available through the Recognizer::text() method.

Returns:
A list of Region objects.

std::vector< unsigned int > Recognizer::spaceLocations (  )  const [inline]

Returns:
An array of integers, each one representing the position where a blank space must be inserted when building the text in postprocessing.

const Text & Recognizer::text (  )  const [inline]

Returns:
A Text object with the recognized characters forming a meaningful content.

void Recognizer::trainClassifier ( const Clip &  pressClip,
const std::vector< std::string > &  referenceText,
const ClassificationParadigm &  paradigm 
)

Parameters:
pressClip Press clip to be processed.
referenceText A text to compare with the classification results character by character.
paradigm Paradigm that must be used to classify the patterns found in the press clip.
Postcondition:
The internal dataset is updated according to the user responses, e.g. new samples might be added.
Todo:
Implement a better mechanism to pass the reference text, since an array of strings avoids the problem of internationalization, but it is not useful for an external user.
